entry.title: Integration of Batch-specific Unit of Measure( BSUOM) with EWM on SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS01
entry.content:
Batch Specific UOM- It is an alternative unit of a material for which the conversion ratio to the base unit of measure can be defined on a batch-specific basis.

Primarily used in Steel, Pharma, Chemicals, Life sciences or its usage can be ubiquitous if Base to AUOM conversion is not fixed for the given product.

Batch Specific UOM( BSUOM) has 2 major attributes.

  1.  Proportion Unit
  2. Product Unit

This blog will focus primarily on Product Unit, Proportion Unit( Active Pharma Ingredient API) will be handled in Part II of this blog series.

Product Unit- Unit of measure that describes the total quantity of a material as an alternative to the base unit of measure.

Example. A piece of  particular material weighs 100 Kg, however in maximum cases, vendor weight size never adheres to fixed conversion ration maintained in material master like 1 PC=100 KG, sometimes it is more than standard conversion ratio. 

To handle this dynamic UOM conversion & incorporate different weight for each batch, SAP has tool called as Batch Specific UOM( BSUOM) to handle the quantity conversion on 'Batch Basis'. 

There are 3 major elements of Batch Specific UOM( BSUOM)

  • Base UOM
  • Alternate UOM( Product Unit)
  • Intermediate UOM

As a thump rule, Batch specific UOM( BSUOM) is always a alternate UOM which varies dynamically on batch basis. In Our case, Piece is always changing & hence it has to AUOM as 1 PC=105 KG, 1 PC=110 KG, 1PC=115 KG.

Base UOM= KG, Alternate UOM= PC

Batch Specific UOM( Intermediate UOM)= K/P( KG Per Piece)

How SAP Handles Batch Specific UOM( BSUOM)?

  • Define the KG( Weight) per Piece as a characteristic for batches.( CT04)

  • Create Intermediate UOM- CUNI- KG/P

  • Assign this Characteristics to a class and assign the class to Material Master.

  • Assign the class in Material Master of Product( A planned conversion ratio has to be maintained)

Configuration:

  • Activate Batch Specific UOM

SCM Extended Warehouse Management-->Cross-Process Settings-->Batch Management-->Activate Batch-Specific Units of Measure( This configuration can be activated from Batch Management side as well in OCHA)

  • Configure Product Quantities calculation( OCHA)

Quick check

Create a PO in Product Unit of Measure( AUOM)= PC

Batch specific UOM is supported in Synchronous posting 101 against Purchase Order( MIGO). What is supported and what are restriction is mentioned in SAP note( 3398656 - Release information and restrictions of batch-specific Unit of Measure in EWM on SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS01

.Receiving of 1 PC.

 

Click on the classification tab and  enter KG/Piece of shipment =105( As lot received from supplier in this example)

Weight is dynamically adjusted bases on Conversion factor at characteristics level

 Doing 2 more GRs for 110 kg & 115 KG corresponding to 1 PC.

Check Stock Situation in EWM & S4.

In EWM, AUoM quantity = BUoM quantity divided by batch conversion factor.
Stock is always moved in the AUoM:
‚Ä¢ In warehouse task creation and
‚Ä¢ In warehouse task confirmation. 

S4 Stock

Batch Specific UOM( BSUOM) Class:

Rules of product unit of measure in EWM

AUoM quantity = BUoM quantity divided by batch conversion factor.
Stock is always moved in the AUoM:
‚Ä¢ In warehouse task creation and
‚Ä¢ In warehouse task confirmation.
No stock in warehouse without batch conversion factor maintained. 
‚Ä¢ At goods receipt posting or
‚Ä¢ Initial stock upload
For the AUoM = Product Unit only whole numbers (e.g. 1 PC, 10 PC, 3 PC) are allowed:
‚Ä¢ It must not be possible to get stock or warehouse tasks with decimal product unit values (AUoM)
‚Ä¢ BUoM can have decimal values.

Supported functionalities in EWM for Batch Specific UOM

Limitation:

‚Ä¢ More than one product unit for one material
‚Ä¢ All synchronous postings except for movement type 101
‚Ä¢ EWM TM integration

  • Decentral EWM( In Roadmap S/4 HANA 2025)

Check SAP note for list of detailed limitation.

3398656 - Release information and restrictions of batch-specific Unit of Measure in EWM on SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS01

3526169 - BsUoM - Adapted error handling for Product Unit Material

3507014 - Batch-specific quantity conversion - optimization of internal buffers

3585735 - /SCWM/MATERIAL_QUAN_CONV - the quantity ev_quan is calculated incorrectly

3585808 - BSUOM issue with quantity conversion

3449965 - Batch-specific quantity conversion - SP0

3468833 - BSUOM Issue with overpicking proportion unit product

References: SAP¬Æ Extended Warehouse Management in SAP S/4HANA ... - SAP Community

All tests are performed in S/4 HANA 2023 FPS02 Sandbox System.

entry.title: Configure Value Mapping. APP eDocument for a non-localized country CE2508
entry.content:
Hello community,

For non-localized countries in SAP Cloud Public Edition, we found these applications in the documentation: Configure Value Mapping. However, for non-localized countries (Central America), we don't have the option to create the namespace for that country; /EDOXX (where XX is the country). The country isn't available in the list.

With extensibility, which BAdI should be implemented or in which application should this namespace be created?

entry.title: Re: Problems faced while using my SAP BTP Trial Account
entry.content:
Hi Peter,

Thanks for providing the necessary information. I logged-in just to update my comments with same observations regarding problem #1, after searching more online.

Problem 2 however resolved itself so it might be a temporary issue, as previously I had re-booted my device after uninstalling and installing Eclipse again.

In my case "Create" button was disabled for both OData versions with or without draft. After problem 2 resolved itself, I could see a warning in V4 Service binding that it will be read-only if draft mode is not enabled.

Once again thanks for your help. I have accepted your answer.

PS - I also enabled BAS in my trial account and tried to do a Full Stack ABAP App. At the beginning itself, I was asked for a package and a transport. I created a TR using ADT and then referred the same. Is this the right approach?

Regards

Abhijit Moholkar

entry.title: Re: How to handle empty Profit Centers during Realignment...
entry.content:
Realignment should be able to handle profit center empty, but profit center value will not substituted as the target fields for realignment and GRPL are seven GR fields in ACDOCA. 
Please try to implement note 3436316 - Realignment: restriction of profit center does not work as expected to see whether realignment works with profit center empty.

entry.title: Why does the FRUN need the Introscope Enterprise Manager?
entry.content:
Hello SAP, 

We are upgrading FRUN 4.0 to FRUN 5.0 , as per the RACI sheet "note DIGITS - Introscope 10.8 Release Notes" says to install Introscope 10.8. But in our system we do not have Introscope installed, given the logs for installation patch of Introscope. 

Best regards,


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Why does the FRUN need the Introscope Enterprise Mana...
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

To ensure performance data collection for non-ABAP managed systems within your network, such as JAVA, BOE, DS, Tomcat, SAP Convergent Charging, and similar products, it is necessary to install one CA Introscope EM per customer network.

This installation is mandatory to enable monitoring and data collection for these systems in FRUN. If these products are present in your environment, please proceed with the installation to facilitate seamless system monitoring.

Please see:

  • Preparing CA APM Enterprise Manager
  • 797147 - Introscope Installation for SAP Customers
  • 3247270 - Introscope 10.8 Release Notes

Best regards,
Vera Jiang

entry.title: Re: Why Can a Contract with Blocked Status in the Source...
entry.content: Hello, Thank you very much for your detailed response. It turns out that I had overlooked the fact that the delivery date of the purchase requisition must fall within the validity period of the source list. The test material I was using has a long procurement lead time, which caused the delivery date to fall outside the valid period in the source list. I‚Äôll also include the additional points you mentioned in my next round of testing and update the configurations accordingly. Thanks again for your helpful insights!

entry.title: LMDB issue for all Web dispatchers after FRUN upgrade
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have recently upgraded SAP Focused Run system to 5.0 FP01 and after upgrade we observed that for system type SAP Web dispatcher all entries have turned red in data completeness check in LMDB.

Entity type: Technical system

Display Name: Installed Kernel Component

Supplier Name: WebDispatcherInstanceKernel

Please advise. Thanks,

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: LMDB issue for all Web dispatchers after FRUN upgrade
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

Since FRUN 5.0, after implementing Note 3628411 - Enhancement of SAP Web Dispatcher Data Supplier Completeness Checks, the LMDB now provides enhanced support for detailed data supplier checks specific to SAP Web Dispatcher.

To send the missing data supplier WebDispatcherInstanceKernel, please follow the steps outlined in Prepare SAP Web Dispatcher. These steps will guide you through the process to ensure the required data supplier is correctly configured and sent.

Best regards,
Vera Jiang

entry.title: Re: Replacement for the deprecated catalog ‚ÄúSAP_CMD_BC_BP...
entry.content:
Hi @RyanMuller,

You are right, I have a very similar situation.

The successor apps and catalogs also did not show up in my system. Our landscape is also a 2-system landscape, and we cannot select that scope item either.

I looked into this issue, and I found out that "Activate Features" is needed. However, I have never done it before, so I didn't know the steps.

But while I was doing the research, I found something. I think the new scope item 7MI might be available only in Germany and the U.S. now.
When you open the "Manage Your Solution" Fiori app and go to "View Solution Scope," you can select the scope item, and it takes you to SAP for Me. I was checking the deprecated and new scope items there. Because 7MI seems to have only a few available countries, I concluded that it is not available in my environment yet.

For now, the deprecated app still works, so I was planning to wait and see if SAP would make it available later. If there's an issue with our environments (yours as well as mine), please let me know.

Best regards,
Ryoma

entry.title: Re: Admin User running Canvas report is unable to see Own...
entry.content:
Hi @RishabhGupta19881 ,

Admin user should see all data (including self), please check

If in any one of the roles assigned if Target population is excluding to see self-data. or

Person context might have be applied in report and Distance might be selected as only All Descendants or

If there is any filter applied in report excluding self-data or 

Date options might be some older range excluding self-access

Regards,

Subbu

entry.title: Re: How to Trigger notification to HR team after all Onb...
entry.content:
Hi @Gopinath,

Here‚Äôs my approach so far:

  • Created an Email Category using the Onboarding Content Builder and set the Recipient Builder as Onboarding Role-Based Recipient Builder.
  • Created an Email Trigger using the email category created earlier.
  • Created an Email Template linked to both the email category and trigger.
  • Created a Business Rule where the IF condition includes all the tasks that need to be completed, including custom MDF objects like the Super and Tax forms. Added a condition in the business rule to trigger the email template once all the tasks are completed.

Despite this setup, I‚Äôm not receiving the notification email after completing all the steps.

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 6: SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur
entry.content:
This sixth post in my series gives an overview of user experience innovations in SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur. For SAP Customer Experience, look at the new AI agents and the capability to build custom agents, plus AI innovations for marketeers in SAP Emarsys, and Joule and Ai order summaries in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2.  SAP Concur takes travel planning to the next level with the whole new travel experience, complemented by the new Joule Booking Agent enabling users to use natural language to book a trip.

Before reading this, do read the first blog post introducing the series and providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services, along with links to all the published parts of this blog post series:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

 

SAP Customer Experience

The user experience highlights I have picked are all AI-related:

  • AI Agents.
  • SAP Emarsys UX innovations.
  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 UX innovations.

This news article summarizes what‚Äôs new overall for SAP Customer Experience, beyond UX-related innovations:

  • Connected for Growth: What‚Äôs New with SAP Customer Experience in Q2 2025.

AI Agents

As I explained in part 1 of this series, AI agents work in the background to give a greatly enhanced user experience. A number of powerful AI agents are available for SAP Customer Experience, via the package Joule Premium for Customer Experience. This blog post and video give a nice overview of three of them in action:

  • AI Agents in Action.
  • Video: See How AI Agents Streamline Customer Service (3:11 min.)

The latest UX innovations are:

  • Shopping Agent for the Shopping Assistant.
  • Digital Service Agent (via Early Adopter Care program).
  • Ability to create custom agents in the CX AI Toolkit.

AI Shopping Agent for the SAP Commerce Cloud Shopping Assistant

The shopping agent helps customers when visiting an online shop: they can simply use natural language to state what they are looking for, and the shopping agent will respond with suitable suggestions. Figure 1 shows an example, where the user starts out by stating that they are looking for shoes to wear for two mile long walks while wearing a suit. Two shoes are suggested, and the user asks which one is comfortable right away, since he doesn‚Äôt want a long break in period. The agent recommends one model, and the customer then asks for a recommendation for a belt to match, which the agent promptly gives him.

Figure 1: Shopping Agent for the Shopping Assistant from SAP Commerce Cloud. Alt Text: three screenshots of a tall and narrow screen showing a chat, one for each of the interactions explained in the main text. Each response shows one or two images: in the first case two shoes, then one shoe and then one men‚Äôs belt.

Find out more here, and watch the video embedded there to see it in action:

  • SAP Discovery Center: Shopping Agent

Digital Service Agent

The new digital service agent helps to provide your customers with a great user experience, similar to how the shopping agent is aimed primarily at your customers. It enables customers to ask questions with natural language and provides answers based on your company‚Äôs business knowledge residing in the SAP system. Hence, it is able to resolve common inquiries and issues, giving customers a good experience. Furthermore, by freeing up you sales and service team to focus on more complex inquiries, your customers will also receive a better service and hence better experience.

The digital serice agent is currently only available for select customers via the Early Adopter Care program. Figure 2 in the next section shows how these customers can select it in the AI Agent Builder.

Find out more here:

  • SAP Discovery Center: Digital Service Agent.

Create Custom Agents with CX AI Toolkit

You can now create your own custom agents with the CX AI toolkit. Figure 2 shows the start screen for the AI Agent Builder, where you can select ‚ÄúCustom Tool‚Äù to start the wizard which takes you through the steps to create a custom agent.

Figure 2: The AI Agent Builder in the CX AI Tookit for creating custom AI agents or using SAP templates to create AI agents. Alt Text: A screenshot with ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs Create AI Agents‚Äù in large text in the middle below an illustration, below in much smaller text ‚ÄúStart by selecting an Agent Template‚Äù. Below that, two rows of three cards representing Agent Templates are shown: Custom Tool, Knowledge Agent, Classification Agent, Digital Service Agent, Q/A Agent, and Shopping Assistant Agent.

Find out more here:

  • Documentation: Create a Custom AI Agent.

Further Information on AI Agents for SAP Customer Experience

For a deeper understanding of the power of these AI agents, have a look at this longer video:

  • Video: SAP CX AI Toolkit: AI Insights Agents for SAP C4C & Shopping Assistant | Product Inspiration Series (32:21 min.)

SAP Emarsys

AI-Assisted Report Builder using Natural Language

You can now easily create a report using natural language to describe what you are interested in. Figure 3 shows an example of the entry screen. At the bottom you see hints on what kind of queries you can enter.

Figure 3: AI-assisted report builder in SAP Emarsys. Alt Text: A screenshot with ‚ÄúUnlock the Power of Data with the AI-assisted Report Builder‚Äù in the middle. At the top a text entry field containing the query ‚ÄúWhat are the Sent, Delivered, Bounced, Opened, Clicked, Purchased, Unsubscribed, Complained for my Email campaigns in the past month?‚Äù, to the right an AI button ‚ÄúGenerate Report‚Äù. At the bottom of the screen two example queries are listed.

Once you have created the report, you can easily adjust it using a set of convenient filters, such as the date range as well as the list of campaigns and metrics. Watch this video to see it in action:

  • Video: AI-assisted Report Builder (46 seconds).

AI-assisted Product Finder using Natural Language (Pilot)

Pilot customers can now try out the new AI-assisted product finder, which allows users to search for product to add to marketing campaigns using natural language. Figure 4 shows an example of how to enter your search text, see more here:

  • Video: AI-assisted Product Finder (38 seconds).

Figure 4: AI-assisted product finder available to SAP Emarsys pilot customers. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a screen with a left half containing the Product Finder, with a search field containing ‚ÄúMost popular shoes in the last 6 month‚Äù, above an empty space with the text ‚ÄúWelcome to Product Finder!‚Äù in the middle. The right half shows an image of someone dancing in the sun and an image of a dress, along with some describing text.

Read more about latest SAP Emarsys innovations here:

  • SAP Emarsys Q2 2025 Product Release.
  • SAP Emarsys introduces new generative AI capabilities in June Product Release

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2

Joule in SAP Sales Cloud

Joule is now available in SAP Sale Cloud Verion 2, helping users get quick insights, for example about an account. As you can see in Figure 5, these insights can be charts as well as text based.

Figure 5: Joule for SAP Sales Cloud Version 2. Alt Text: A screenshot of Joule showing Customer Account Overview, with the text ‚ÄúShow Key Metrics‚Äù entered as chat, below which a card with a vertical stacked bar chart shows credit limit usage (remaining amount and exposure amount), below that a card showing Key Metrics (Activity) and part of a donut chart for Tasks, Phone Calls, Appointments, Visits etc.

Have a deeper look here:

  • Video: Intelligent Selling with Joule in SAP Sales Cloud & SAP S/4HANA Cloud | Product Inspiration Series (16:04 min.)

Sales Order Summary

The Sales Order Summary uses generative AI to summarize key information about the sales order, as well as including information about some changes, for example how the price compares to the original price. Figure 6 shows an example, with the insights shown on the left of the screen.

Figure 6: Sales Order Summary in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a sales order, with the left third showing an overview with AI-generated insights such as ‚Äú13 days past requested date‚Äù, ‚ÄúOverall discount is EUR 808.55‚Äù. On the right, the Order Summary tab is shown, with account name, net and gross value, pricing stats, above ‚ÄúProducts in Cart (2)‚Äù showing a list of two products, followed by the top part of a list of pricing steps.

Learn more here:

  • Documentation: Sales Order Summary.

 

SAP Concur

The new Concur Travel experience makes it much easier to book travel involving multiple bookings, such as a flight plus hotel plus rental car. And if you just need to book one item, you can do that very easily now with the new Booking Agent powered by Joule.

New Concur Travel Experience

When travelling for a few days, one often needs to book more than one item. A typical combination is booking a flight, a hotel and a rental car. Up until now, you have had to book each item separately and take care that the dates and time match. Now, with the new Concur Travel experience, planning and booking is much easier: you can enter the start and end dates for your flight, and the new feature Match Flight Booking is applied to the hotel and car, so that dates and time match automatically.

Figures 7 to 11 show what this looks like: Figure 7 shows the start screen, where you select which items you want to include (flight, hotel, car, train). Figure 8 shows the flight view, where flight dates have been entered. Figure 9 shows the hotel search, with the default selection ‚ÄúBased on flight selection‚Äù, and similarly Figure 10 shows the rental car search, with pick-up and return times calculated based on the flight schedule. Figure 11 shows the finalize screen, in this case showing that the flight and hotel has been selected but the rental car is still open.

Figure 7: New Concur Travel experience start screen. Alt Text: A screenshot of a pop-over with a large image of a magnifying glass on a globe, above the text ‚ÄúStart Planning‚Äù. Below that four check boxes in a row: Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, Train, at the bottom ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù and ‚ÄúCancel‚Äù buttons.

Figure 8: New Concur Travel experience screen with flight details. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a trip planning for a Trip to Las Vegas. The left third of the screen shows a list with items Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, with Flight selected. Below the list buttons ‚ÄúAdd to trip‚Äù and ‚ÄúSearch‚Äù. On the right a selector for round-trip (selected), one-way or multi-city, with fields for from / to locations and a date field for the stard and end date. To the right a button ‚ÄúTime preferences‚Äù and a drop-down for selecting ‚ÄúCabin‚Äù.

Figure 9: New Concur Travel experience screen with hotel details. Alt Text: As for Figure 8, but with Hotel selected, and on the right Hotel Search displayed, with the fields for ‚ÄúHotel, location, or name‚Äù and ‚ÄúDates‚Äù filled with the text ‚ÄúBased on flight selection‚Äù.

 Figure 10: New Concur Travel experience screen with rental car details. Alt Text: As for Figure 9, but with Rental Car selected, and on the right Rental Car Search displayed, with the fields for ‚ÄúPickup‚Äù and ‚ÄúDates‚Äù filled with the text ‚ÄúBased on flight selection‚Äù and the field ‚ÄúDrop-off‚Äù filled with ‚ÄúSame as pickup‚Äù. Pickup Time and Drop-off Time fields have 10:00 AM entered.

Figure 11: New Concur Travel experience finalize screen. Alt Text: Screenshot showing ‚ÄúTrip to Las Vegas‚Äù on the left two-thirds, with a card summarizing the flight with United Airlines from San Antonio, TX (SAT) ‚Äì Las Vegas, NV (LAS) and a card summarizing the hotel Courtyard by Marriott Las Vegas. The right third shows the Estimated Total Cost $2497.85 above a list with the cost of each item (flight, hotel, rental car), and buttons for ‚ÄúFinalize Trip‚Äù and ‚ÄúCancel Trip‚Äù, and options to book anything else (Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, Train).

As you can see in Figure 11, another advantage of the new experience is that you get budget transparency at the trip level. Also, you have flexibility to book parts of the travel now and other parts later.

Technically it supports deep linking, which means that you can send a trip-level link to colleagues which includes all the trip parts, making it easy to coordinate trip planning when travelling with others.

To find out more, have a look at the

  • Documentation: Trip Planning in New Concur Travel.

Booking Agent in Concur Travel

The new Booking Agent lets you use natural language to book business travel which is compliant with company policy and budget constraints as well as taking into account your personal travel preferences.

Figure 12 shows an example where the user has simply stated ‚ÄúI want to book a flight from San Francisco to London on Sept 9th and back on Sept 13th‚Äù. The answer shown takes into account the user‚Äôs frequent traveler memberships, flight availability and company policies.

Figure 12: New Concur Travel Booking Agent in Joule. Alt Text: A screenshot of Concur Travel with Joule opened on the right, the content is explained in the main text, with the possible flights listed alongside a thumbnail image representing the airline ‚ÄújetBlue‚Äù.

Watch it in action and find out more:

  • Video: Concur Travel ‚Äì Booking Agent demo (2:33 min.)
  • SAP Discovery Center: Booking Agent.

 

Continued soon‚Ä¶

I hope you enjoyed this sixth part, covering SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur, with great new AI-powered user experiences helping users work more efficiently and effectively.

The final part seven is coming later this week, covering latest innovations in UI technologies.

Part 1 of the series lists all the parts, and links to those parts that have already been published:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

entry.title: Re: VFX3 display billing amount
entry.content:
Unfortunately, VFX3 does not show the billing amount by default, and the standard layout doesn‚Äôt include that field. You need to go with developing the ALV layout either via User Exit or BAdI

You can work with your technical team to enhance the ALV grid using a user exit or BAdI (e.g., SDVFX) to include the billing amount field. This involves fetching the amount from VBRK-NETWR to fetch the total amount per billing document and injecting it into the ALV structure. Join VBRK with the billing document number (VBRK-VBELN) that‚Äôs already present in VFX3‚Äôs internal table. Inject the value into the ALV structure via enhancement or user exit. This ensures you're showing the correct total and avoids the complexity of summing multiple VBRP entries.

entry.title: Re: Is possible to use Tricentis Tosca in SAP CALM?
entry.content:
Hi LucasBeccon,

Yes, it is possible to use Tricentis Tosca with SAP Cloud ALM. SAP provides a smooth, one-click integration between Tricentis and SAP Cloud ALM, enabling customers to leverage powerful test automation capabilities directly within their ALM processes.

SAP Cloud ALM is the new ALM product offering from SAP, designed to support the move from on-premise to cloud. As part of this shift, SAP announced that mainstream support for CBTA will end after 2027. To ensure customers continue to have strong test automation options, SAP partnered with Tricentis.

Additionally, Tricentis can also integrate with SAP Solution Manager for customers who are still using on-premise solutions.

For more details, you can refer to:

  • Tricentis Test Automation for SAP in SAP Cloud ALM
  • SAP ALM Partners ‚Äì Test Automation

Thanks,

Nilabh

entry.title: Re: Facing issue while assigning automated test cases fro...
entry.content:
Hi SAPSupport,

To assign test cases from Tricentis Test Automation (TTA) to a Test Plan in your SAP Cloud ALM project, you'll first need to ensure the test cases are properly imported and synchronized with SAP Cloud ALM.

This process is handled via the Test Preparation app in SAP Cloud ALM. Within this app, you‚Äôll find dedicated actions to:

  • Import test cases from TTA
  • Synchronize any updates or changes to those test cases

Once imported, the test cases will be available for assignment to your Test Plan within the project.

For a complete step-by-step guide, please refer to SAP Knowledge Base Article 3598767 ‚Äî it covers the integration and synchronization process in detail.

If you've already connected TTA with SAP Cloud ALM, this setup allows for seamless orchestration and traceability of your automated tests directly from Cloud ALM.

Let me know if you'd like help navigating the Test Preparation app or configuring the test plan!

 

Thanks,

Nilabh

entry.title: Batch Determination Not Triggering in MIGO 261 but Works in Production Order Backflush
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am facing an issue with batch determination during goods issue for a production order.

Requirement: Batch determination should happen during goods issue (movement type 261) for both backflush and non-backflush components against a Production Order.

Current Situation:

  • I have set up the required batch determination configuration at Inventory Management level for movement type 261.

  • During production order confirmation with backflush (CO11N/CO15), batch determination works correctly and proposes batches automatically for the components.

  • However, during a manual goods issue in MIGO with movement type 261, batch determination does not trigger for the components and I need to enter the batches manually.

Could you please advise if I am missing any important configuration or additional steps to achieve this?

Thanks in advance,


Varun.

entry.title: Re: How to configure Reason for late coming or leave earl...
entry.content:
Hi Raf,

The time events will come from an external system and valuation will occur where those time events will be linked to the attendance time type "Recorded Working Time".

Currently, we have set up alerts on the Time Sheet for employees having exceptions for their attendance such as late in, early out, missing clock in/out etc. I have thought of configuring a custom field called "Justification" and this field will be required when there is an attendance exception alert and the user can explain on why they logged in late or left work early for example. However, it is not possible to do so because the custom field will be enabled for all Time Types and the client doesn't want that. This is mainly because we have configured time types for the users to apply for Overtime.

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud ALM and Tricentis TTA - SAP Standard Test s...
entry.content:
Hi SAPSupport,

When working with Tricentis Test Automation (TTA) integrated with SAP Cloud ALM, it‚Äôs important to distinguish between what‚Äôs available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

Public Edition ‚Äì Pre-Built Content Available

For the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, there are pre-delivered automated test scenarios. These are part of the "Test Automation Tool" specifically designed for the public cloud and are based on the SAP Best Practices from the SAP Activate Roadmap. These pre-built tests can be imported and orchestrated via SAP Cloud ALM ‚Äî helping customers get started with test automation quickly and efficiently.

Private Edition ‚Äì Custom Automation with Tricentis TTA

For the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, there is no out-of-the-box pre-packaged test content available at this time ‚Äî either from SAP Cloud ALM or within Tricentis Test Automation. However, this doesn't limit your ability to automate:

  • You can build your own tailored test scenarios in Tricentis TTA, including support for SAP GUI, Fiori, and custom applications.
  • Once created, these test cases can be synchronized with SAP Cloud ALM.
  • SAP Cloud ALM then allows you to orchestrate test runs and gain centralized test reporting and traceability.

While it's a more hands-on approach in the Private Edition, the benefit is a fully customizable and scalable test automation framework tailored to your specific landscape and processes.

Looking Ahead

Tricentis and SAP continuously evolve their toolsets. While pre-packaged tests aren't currently available for Private Edition, the integration already provides a robust platform for end-to-end test automation and governance‚Äîand future content packs or accelerators may become available as the ecosystem matures.

 

Thanks,

Nilabh

Specifically: - Which CCM document or transaction are you referring to? - What type of privileged information have you observed being included? Please feel free to share any relevant examples or context that might assist in clarifying the situation further. Looking forward to your response. Best regards, Leo SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Support Request: Realignment Process Issue Leading to...
entry.content:
The error message which you shared is typically points to a data overflow issue, where a field in the underlying program or structure is unable to accommodate the size or precision of the values being processed.

Check the below likely root causes

  • Each realignment may be creating new postings or adjusting existing ones. If the same document is realigned multiple times, it could result in cumulative values that exceed the field length (e.g., currency amounts or quantity fields).
  • The error suggests that a calculation field (likely in a structure used by FAGLL03) is not sized appropriately to handle the data. This could be due to a mismatch between Group Reporting ledger values and GL line item display logic.
  • Realignment may have introduced inconsistent or duplicate entries in the Universal Journal (ACDOCA) or Group Reporting Preparation Ledger (GRPL). FAGLL03 might be trying to calculate totals or balances that exceed expected limits.

Perform the below steps

  • Review the realignment version settings and ensure that the same documents are not being realigned repeatedly without reversal. If needed, reverse previous realignment runs before executing a new one.
  • Try running FAGLL03 with limited selection criteria (e.g., specific company code, document number, or posting date) to isolate the problematic entry.
  • Use SE16N or CDS views to inspect the ACDOCA entries for the affected documents. Look for unusually large values or duplicate postings.
  • Last but not least, still if your error is not resolved, this error may require a code-level fix or note from SAP.  So, raise a ticket to SAP, include the exact error message, dump ID (from ST22), and details of the realignment runs in your support ticket.

entry.title: Re: TTA for SAP integrated with SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
Hi Rayane,

  • Predefined Test Scripts in TTA:
    Currently, there are no predefined (ready-to-use) test scripts available within Tricentis Test Automation for SAP (TTA). You will not find pre-delivered scripts inside TTA itself.
  • Using SAP Best Practices for Automatic Script Creation:
    Direct import of SAP Best Practice process models into TTA to automatically generate executable scripts is not supported. However, you can leverage SAP Cloud ALM‚Äôs process models (including SAP Best Practices content) as a reference and then design your test cases in TTA based on these models.
  • Creating Test Scripts in TTA:
    If predefined content is not available, you need to create your test scripts from scratch in TTA. The advantage is that TTA allows you to build modular test steps and reusable components, making script creation and maintenance easier over time.
  • Tricentis Licenses in SAP Cloud ALM:
    Yes, currently SAP Cloud ALM provides five included Tricentis Test Automation licenses per tenant. These licenses are intended for productive use, with limitations on the number of users who can design and execute automated test cases simultaneously. If additional capacity is required, customers can extend their licenses directly with Tricentis.

Thanks,

Nilabh

entry.title: Re: With how many recording licenses does TTA come with?
entry.content:
Hi Justin,

When you use Tricentis Test Automation (TTA) through SAP Cloud ALM, it includes 5 named user licenses for test creation and execution ‚Äî often referred to as ‚Äúrecording licenses.‚Äù

These licenses are:

  • Provided at no additional cost as part of your SAP Cloud ALM entitlement
  • Intended for test designers and automation engineers to create, edit, and maintain automated test cases
  • Tied to named users, meaning each license is assigned to a specific individual

If your testing needs go beyond the 5 included licenses, you would need to engage with SAP or Tricentis to explore additional licensing options based on your project scope.

Thanks,

Nilabh

entry.title: Re: How to find the line items that made up settlement? T...
entry.content:
To be honest, I don't have patience to go through all your coding lines but let me try to explain the logic which might address your requirement.

The Key to Distribution Rules of COBRB is it stores settlement rules for internal orders and other CO objects. It includes:

  • OBJNR: Object number (e.g., internal order)
  • PERBZ: Settlement type (e.g., periodic, full)
  • PROZS: Percentage for settlement
  • BETRR: Amount for amount-based rules
  • PS_PSP_PNR: WBS element (receiver)
  • AUFNR: Order number (sender)
  • GJAHR / PERIO: Validity period

SAP uses these rules during settlement (e.g., via transaction KO88) to distribute costs from sender to receiver. If you're joining your source data to COBRB, you can apply the percentage logic to split the amounts accordingly. Importantly, SAP rounds percentages to 3 decimals internally, but the actual distribution may involve equivalence numbers (AQZIF) or remaining amount logic (BREST). These can cause minor rounding differences that are hard to trace.

So you can try the below approach

  • COBRA contains settlement document metadata ‚Äî useful for linking to the actual settlement run.
  • If you want to trace back to the original postings, COEP (CO line items) is your best friend. It contains OBJNR, BELNR, BUZEI, VRGNG, WRTTP, BEKNZ. You can filter by VRGNG = 'SETT' and BEKNZ ‚â† 'A' to isolate relevant lines.
  • If you're on S/4HANA, SAP provides CDS views like I_ActualCOLineItemCube that simplify access to COEP and related tables.

So in short,

entry.title: Re: Query on j2ee_admin user id change in SAP SOLMAN 7.2...
entry.content:
Dear Appuru,

Is j2ee_adm_dev similar to the j2ee_admin? As far as I know that J2EE_ADMIN user is for Java Stack Administration. But solution manager Java doesn't really need to maintain it somewhere as the standard configuration. According to the Solman Security Guide, 
----------------------------------------------------------------------
This user is available on SAP dual stack systems. However, SAP recommends using the SMD_AGT_ADM user credentials during RCA setup. This user account can be useful for tasks such as manual user creation or UME role / J2EE security role assignment, and SLD configuration and validation procedures.

When configuring the J2EE Administrator, we strongly recommend to:

  • remove the role SAP_J2EE_ADMIN from users. For more information, see the section on Configuration User SOLMAN_ADMIN.

  • assign the setup user read and write access to the SPML service as described in SAP Note 1647157 
     

     

     for user maintenance.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Given this, the individual configuring the `j2ee_adm_dev` user should have clarity on where it is maintained to ensure proper setup and adherence to best practices.

Best regards,
Vera Jiang
